item.title: How to maintain Antarctica's ice runway
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Denmark and Greenland reject Trump's offer to send naval hospital ship
item.description: Denmark and its territory Greenland reject Donald Trump's offer to send a naval hospital ship to the Arctic island coveted by the US leader.

item.title: Neighbouring farmers say overwhelming fire risk from Lake Magenta Nature Reserve in WA's south-east
item.description: WA farmer Doug Giles has warned that parts of Lake Magenta Nature Reserve haven't been burned in 25 years, raising fears of a dangerous fire.

item.title: MAGA figure tells Australian conservatives Angela Merkel did more damage to Germany's fabric than Nazis
item.description: Benjamin Harnwell, the "international editor" of Steve Bannon's War Room podcast, says centre-right politicians have "betrayed" the West by supporting "mass immigration".

item.title: Wayne Klingberg avoids jail over crash that killed his employee in rollover near Hamley Bridge
item.description: A man has been spared jail time after his "substandard" driving resulted in a crash that caused the death of his passenger.

item.title: What experts want you to know about endometriosis, diagnosis and surgery as treatment
item.description: Allegations about endometriosis surgery have alarmed experts and distressed women living with the condition. Here's what to know about the chronic disease that affects about one in seven Australian women.

item.title: More details emerge after man shot dead by Secret Service at Mar-a-Lago
item.description: Austin Tucker Martin was seen at the Mar-a-Lago resort's north gate at about 1:30am on Sunday, local time. He has been described as being from a family of "big Trump supporters".

item.title: Two men charged after man stabbed during confrontation in Kambalda
item.description: Two men are charged and another is flown to Perth with life-threatening stab wounds, after a weekend altercation in Kambalda.

item.title: Darcy Moore downplays Collingwood's injury woes, Patrick Dangerfield optimistic on Jeremy Cameron's health
item.description: Several of Collingwood's defensive stalwarts have suffered interrupted preseasons, but skipper Darcy Moore isn't concerned just yet.

item.title: SA pastoralists receive more than 60mm of rain in 24 hours
item.description: South Australian pastoralists are preparing to buy livestock after the weekend's downpours brought more than 60 millimetres to some areas.

item.title: Cyber attack takes major chicken processor Hazeldenes offline leaving businesses without meat
item.description: A cyber attack at Hazeldenes chicken processing plant in central Victoria has stalled production and left butchers and pubs across the state without chicken.

item.title: Death of Kelly T'Hart inspires shake up of WA driving laws
item.description: Tougher WA driving laws are expected to be introduced to parliament after a drunk driver, who was charged with killing a 32-year-old, was allowed to drive just two months after the incident.

item.title: Former UK PM Gordon Brown urges police to investigate if Andrew used RAF bases to meet Epstein
item.description: Former British prime minister Gordon Brown urges British police to investigate whether Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor used taxpayer-funded jets and Royal Air Force bases to meet with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Horse endoscopy
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: These four salads are tasty and substantial meals
item.description: If you’re after a healthy and summery dinner, these salads are a meal in a bowl and will tempt even the salad avoiders.

item.title: Richmond forward Mykelti Lefau suspended for two matches over drink driving charge
item.description: Mykelti Lefau is banned for two matches after a drink driving charge that will see him miss a pre-season clash as well as round one.

item.title: Police bodycam footage captures 'retributive' force used on St Edmund's College hit-and-run driver
item.description: Body-camera footage released by the ACT Supreme Court shows tactical police officers using force on a handcuffed hit-and-run driver outside St Edmund's College.

item.title: Bodycam footage shows tactical police officers using force on a handcuffed hit-and-run driver
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Toddler found unresponsive at Sydney day care may have died from a bacterial infection, inquest hears
item.description: A baby who died after being found unresponsive at a Sydney day care may have had a bacterial infection, an inquest has heard.

item.title: SA Police postpone renewed search for missing Andamooka woman Trisha Graf
item.description: Heavy rain has forced police to postpone a search for missing mother Trisha Graf in mine shafts near the outback South Australian town of Andamooka.

item.title: Arvind Ajay Singh extradited from Fiji to Sunshine Coast on rape charge
item.description: A Fijian national charged over the alleged rape of a child four years ago returns to Australia.

item.title: Tabatha Badger angling to replace outgoing Greens senator Peter Whish-Wilson
item.description: Tasmanian Greens MP Tabatha Badger is among the names vying to replace outgoing federal senator Peter Whish-Wilson.

item.title: The Lion King musical makes its return to Sydney
item.description: The Lion King musical makes its return to Sydney in April with the cast and crew opening its doors to rehearsals for a sneak peak.

item.title: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas speaks to 7.30
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Former youth worker Geoffrey Guest pleads not guilty to historical child sex abuse
item.description: Geoffrey John Guest is standing trial in Cairns after being charged with the abuse of a child in the 1970s.

item.title: Australia first Commonwealth country to back removing Mountbatten-Windsor from line of succession
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese tells his British counterpart, Sir Keir Starmer, that Australia would support removing Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor from the royal line of succession. New Zealand has also backed the move.

item.title: Met Gala dress code announced as 'Fashion is Art' by New York's Museum of Metropolitan Art
item.description: The dress code for this year's Met Gala will be "Fashion is Art", the Metropolitan Museum of Art has announced.

item.title: Simon Burke on how 19 years of Play School fed into The Elocution of Benjamin Franklin
item.description: After five years starring in major musicals, Simon Burke returns to a much smaller stage in a one-man play, on its 50-year anniversary: The Elocution of Benjamin Franklin.

item.title: What is the difference between a homebirth and a freebirth?
item.description: Experts say creating awareness around how homebirthing and freebirthing differ is important in helping women make informed and safe decisions.

item.title: Power supply for Macquarie Point stadium not yet costed or planned as key deadlines approach
item.description: Major upgrades to Hobart's power grid to supply the Macquarie Point stadium are yet to be finalised or costed, with the final estimate for the precinct's energy demand increasing by almost 50 per cent in a year.

item.title: Trump's dispute with Denmark over Greenland 'far from over', warns intelligence expert
item.description: A former chief analyst with the Danish Defence Intelligence Service warns diplomatic efforts to settle the Greenland dispute will fail.

item.title: Could Canada and Australia form a critical minerals supergroup?
item.description: Canberra's decision to sign a bilateral agreement with Canada to join forces on everything to do with critical minerals could prove to be a forerunner of things to come.

item.title: Australian exporters on notice as Trump tariff policy thrown into uncertainty
item.description: Business representatives have warned all Australian exporters they will need to monitor US trade policy carefully over coming weeks and months, as one firm owner estimates tariffs have cost him $1 million.

item.title: Regulator 'dropped the ball' by dismissing complaints about gynaecologist's practices, expert says
item.description: Australia's medical regulator, AHPRA, faces criticism for failing to act on complaints from patients about surgeries by Melbourne gynaecologist Simon Gordon.

item.title: Urgent care clinics ease emergency department demand but wait times unchanged
item.description: An independent review finds Labor's urgent care clinics face workforce shortages and problems with after-hours services, with no evidence hospital waiting times have improved.

item.title: Peter Mandelson arrested at residence in London
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro speaks to ABC Sport's Amanda Shalala.
item.description: Sport news, live scores, features, analysis and photos from the world of sport. Comprehensive coverage of AFL, cricket, football, rugby league and rugby union. Audio interviews. News stories and highlights in video. Sports news bulletin.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro says 'we want to be a dominant force in Asia'
item.description: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro, who has had nine months in charge leading into the Women's Asian Cup starting this week, has bold ambitions for the tournament and the future of women's football.

item.title: Regional Victoria among the worst areas for meth use police say after Shepparton bust
item.description: Police say methylamphetamine trafficking is "insidious" in regional Victoria, with almost one trafficker a week charged over the past year.

item.title: DV attacker photographed victim giving evidence, found guilty of contempt of court
item.description: A man standing trial for domestic violence charges took an image of the victim while she was giving evidence and recorded the prosecutor inside the court building, a court has heard.

item.title: Solomon Islands denies China will run new police station in the heart of the capital Honiara
item.description: Authorities in Solomon Islands deny claims that Chinese police will run a new police post in Honiara's Chinatown district, but say Chinese police will instead "visit" the site.

item.title: Hope south-east Queensland koala population can recover but advocates remain wary
item.description: Urbanisation has decimated south east Queensland's koala population, but new analysis suggests the decline has slowed in some areas.

item.title: Nathan Cleary's ban overturned as father acts as counsel at NRL judiciary
item.description: Ivan Cleary's legal prowess comes in handy as his son, Panthers star Nathan Cleary, sees his two-match suspension overturned at the NRL judiciary.

item.title: Crimes against humanity hearings against former Philippine leader Rodrigo Duterte open in The Hague
item.description: An International Criminal Court prosecutor tells judges that former Philippines president Rodrigo Duterte personally instructed members of a death squad to kill suspected criminals and drug users.

item.title: Inspection reveals substandard housing for PALM scheme workers in Gippsland
item.description: Migrant workers in Victoria's east were made to pay $190 a week to their employer for overcrowded, mouldy accommodation.

item.title: Nick Reiner pleads not guilty to murder of parents Rob and Michele Singer Reiner
item.description: Nick Reiner has pleaded not guilty to two counts of first-degree murder in the fatal stabbing of his parents in December last year.

item.title: Economist warns rural NSW shires are on the verge of financial ruin
item.description: Huge areas, spiralling costs and a small revenue base do not add up for a growing number of councils in NSW.

item.title: William Barton on blending the ancient First Nations instrument, the yidaki, with classical music
item.description: Virtuoso William Barton, renowned for bringing together First Nations culture and European classical music, reflects on heritage and the lifelong pull of the yidaki.

item.title: SA wildlife carers help animals hurt in Deep Creek fires as they emerge from refuges
item.description: As the firefighters packed up and went home from the recent Deep Creek fires, other volunteers were just starting weeks of work finding injured wildlife in the charred landscape.

item.title: Carney plans Australia trip to tighten trade and defence ties after warning of world order 'rupture'
item.description: The Canadian government confirms details of Prime Minister Mark Carney's trip to Australia, where he hopes to deepen ties on trade, defence and critical minerals as his country looks to reduce reliance on the US.

item.title: Alcoa under investigation for alleged breaches of state mining agreement
item.description: Just days after being forced to pay $55 million for unlawfully clearing land in the world's only jarrah forest, it is revealed Alcoa is under investigation for alleged breaches of its agreement with the WA government.

item.title: BAFTA and BBC apologise for racial slur during awards show
item.description: Tourette syndrome advocate John Davidson, who shouted the slur, says it is not a reflection of his personal beliefs.

item.title: Homeless mother refused social housing after Centrelink payments deemed too high
item.description: Welfare payments are Rissa Blakeley's only source of income, but she and her kids have been left with no choice but to live in a park.

item.title: Shimron Hetmyer blasts West Indies to record T20 World Cup score in win over Zimbabwe
item.description: Shimron Hetmyer takes advantage of a dropped chance to blast his way to 85 as the West Indies maintain their unbeaten record at this year's T20 World Cup.

item.title: Volunteer firefighters wasting hours 'babysitting' pole-top fires waiting for Western Power crews
item.description: Volunteer firefighters in regional Western Australia say fatigued crews are frustrated over time spent monitoring pole-top fires before Western Power crews travel to the scene.

item.title: SA Liberal Party indicates One Nation preference as Alex Antic meets with Cory Bernardi
item.description: The South Australian Liberal Party has indicated it may direct preferences to One Nation ahead of Labor and the Greens. It comes as prominent Liberal senator Alex Antic was spotted having drinks with One Nation's lead SA candidate Cory Bernardi, amid speculation over a possible defection.

item.title: Security screening at Burnie Airport could drive airlines away, airport boss warns
item.description: Burnie Airport has been told it will need to introduce security screening, but the airport's director says the cost of doing so will make some services commercially unviable and threaten the airport.

item.title: Victorian premier refers surgeon Simon Gordon allegations to police after Four Corners revelations
item.description: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has referred allegations against gynaecologist Simon Gordon to police, but the government will not conduct its own investigation.

item.title: Sunshine Coast's iconic venue Solbar to close after more than 20 years
item.description: The Sunshine Coast's longest-running live music venue will close this weekend, after more than 20 years of hosting artists and performers.

item.title: Bunbury backpacker hostels ordered to close after asbestos, safety warnings ignored
item.description: Two backpacker hostels in Western Australia's largest regional city have been ordered to shut due to serious health and safety concerns, including asbestos exposure risks.

item.title: The 'first-night effect': Why it's hard to sleep when you're somewhere new
item.description: It's night-time and you're exhausted. But the hotel bed feels wrong. The mini fridge won't stop making that low, irritating hum. The power outlet lights feel brighter than the sun.

item.title: Farmers rally against 96 million litres per year Southern Downs water extraction and bottling facility
item.description: A developer has lodged an application with a rural Queensland council to build a water bottling, storage and export facility.

item.title: More than 70 dead after Mexico's biggest drug lord 'El Mencho' killed
item.description: At least 73 people have died in the attempt to capture cartel leader Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes and in the aftermath of his death.

item.title: Police suspect human remains to be abducted Sydney man
item.description: Eighty-five-year-old Chris Baghsarian was mistakenly snatched from his North Ryde property about 5am on February 13.

item.title: Opposition leader to boycott swearing-in of controversial new NT administrator David Connolly
item.description: Northern Territory Opposition Leader Selena Uibo says she will boycott the swearing-in of incoming administrator David Connolly, whose appointment has been embroiled in controversy due to a series of past social media posts.

item.title: Sam Walsh's eight-year contract extension the biggest deal in Carlton's history
item.description: Carlton locks down Sam Walsh to a massive eight-year contract extension as he turns down the lure of free agency.

item.title: Is couples counselling right for me and will the therapist take sides? An expert explains
item.description: Many people seek out couples counselling when going through a rough patch, or wondering how to improve their relationship. So, how do you decide if it's right for you?

item.title: Grace Tame abuser Nicolaas Bester unfit to stand trial over alleged 'menacing' social media posts
item.description: Nicolaas Ockert Bester has been deemed unfit to stand trial in the Hobart Magistrates Court over three counts of using a carriage service to menace, harass or cause offence.

item.title: Trump Tower developer Altus Property Group's David Young has twice gone bankrupt
item.description: A search by the ABC of federal insolvency records reveals the developer has had personal financial scrapes.

item.title: Australia confirms first full men's tour of South Africa since 2018 ball-tampering scandal
item.description: Steve Smith will be one of five Australian players from the infamous 2018 tour to return to South Africa later this year.

item.title: For some families, the social media ban has made things harder. Here's why
item.description: We spoke with three parents about how it has impacted their family and the different choices they are making around the ban.

item.title: Kash Patel and US men's hockey team under fire after Donald Trump makes joke about women's team
item.description: Viral video of Trump's White House invitation to the US men's hockey team sparks backlash online after the president jokes he would be 'impeached' if he did not also include the gold-medal winning women's team.

item.title: TasWater continues to push for higher water bills, despite regulator knock back
item.description: TasWater has continued to press its case for a steep water bill hike, despite the economic regulator's decision to halve its proposed price earlier this month.

item.title: Farmers are sick of being called 'resilient' and researchers say it's causing real harm
item.description: Farmers and mental health experts say it is time to stop calling farmers "resilient", with concerns it is making it harder for people to ask for, or be offered, help.

item.title: Blizzard hits US Northeast bringing cities to standstill, closing schools and disrupting flights
item.description: A record-breaking snowstorm pummels the north-eastern United States, bringing cities to a near-standstill for millions of residents.

item.title: WA Parliament to debate institutional child sex abuse laws in wake of 'retrograde' High Court decision
item.description: A tense political fight is brewing over the future of laws to compensate survivors of institutional child sexual abuse, as the government faces pressure to expand its scope beyond just churches and religious institutions.

item.title: Former Matildas label new Football Australia membership program a 'silencing mechanism'
item.description: A new membership program launched by Football Australia puts former Matildas players in a difficult position if they want to criticise the governing body.

item.title: Police identify Katherine Sanowski as woman found dead at Bellbird Park house as they launch murder investigation
item.description: A 34-year-old found nearby, known to the victim, is receiving a medical assessment and is yet to speak to police.

item.title: Globetrotting ancient marine amphibians uncovered in lucky Kimberley fossil rediscovery
item.description: A salamander-crocodile type predator survived five extinction events and travelled from waters off Norway to WA's Kimberley coast.

item.title: Former RBA governor Bernie Fraser calls for capital gains tax discount to be scrapped
item.description: Bernie Fraser tells a Senate committee hearing on capital gains tax that, if it were up to him, he would abolish the discount, as he warns younger Australians are watching the unaffordable housing market in "dismay".

item.title: Thousands without power as intense storms sweep across Melbourne
item.description: Storms dumped 50 millimetres of rain on parts of Victoria on Tuesday and cut power to thousands of homes.

item.title: Woman allegedly attempts to snatch hijab from teenage girl in Brisbane
item.description: Queensland Police launch an investigation after a woman allegedly attempted to snatch a hijab from a teenage girl on the Brisbane bayside.

item.title: Could Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor be removed from the line of succession?
item.description: Is it possible to remove him? The short answer is yes — but it would most likely be a time-consuming process involving many parliaments passing legislation.

item.title: Australia has been waiting more than 40 years for a high-speed train
item.description: It has been more than 40 years since the idea of high-speed rail was first floated in Australia, but is it finally about to become a reality?

item.title: Rodney Wayne Williams fails appeal to overturn conviction for murdering pregnant teenager
item.description: Rodney Wayne Williams is serving life in jail for the murder of 16-year-old, pregnant Tiffany Taylor in Waterford West in July 2015.

item.title: AI body suddenly scrapped after 15 months spent finding experts
item.description: It took 15 months to narrow a field of 270 AI experts to 12 appointees for an AI authority, at a cost of almost $200,000, before it was suddenly scrapped by the federal government.

item.title: Gus Lamont's parents release public statement saying their lives have been 'shattered'
item.description: The parents of missing four-year-old Gus Lamont have released a public statement, saying "every moment without him is unbearable".

item.title: Australia's women's team wins first ODI against India by six wickets
item.description: Half-centuries to Alyssa Healy and Beth Mooney help lead Australia to a six-wicket win over India in the first ODI.

item.title: Explosive detection dog Flo Joe posthumously awarded for military service in Afghanistan
item.description: In July 2007, explosive detection dog Flo Joe became the first Australian service dog to locate an improvised explosive device in Afghanistan. Today, she was posthumously recognised for her military service.

item.title: Popular WA outback tourist property Wooleen Station to be sold
item.description: A pastoral station in WA's Murchison region which has become a high-profile example of conservation is to be sold.

item.title: Half the country on flood watch as summer storms bring deluge of rain
item.description: There are widespread warnings for intense rain and potential flooding, as summer storms hit southern states and an unusually slow-moving system soaks central Australia.

item.title: Geoffrey John Guest to face fresh trial after Cairns District Court jury discharged
item.description: The judge decided a witness's "inadmissible" response under cross-examination in the trial of Geoffrey John Guest left her with no choice but to discharge the jury the day after it had been empanelled.

item.title: WA government announces $140m plan to prevent repeat of record-breaking flu season
item.description: Creating more beds and boosting immunisation are key features of a $140 million "winter strategy" aimed at avoiding a repeat of WA's worst-ever flu season.

item.title: Fire ant authority considers penalties for business that spread nests to central Qld
item.description: The National Fire Ant Eradication Program is considering "enforcement actions" for a business accused of spreading nests to Queensland mine sites via a shipment of bricks.

item.title: Most flu deaths this century were recorded in 2025, ABS finds
item.description: There were more deaths associated with influenza last year than any other year this century, according to the Australia Bureau of Statistics.

item.title: New ACT firearms laws would allow police to search property of 'high-risk' individuals
item.description: The ACT government's plan to strengthen firearms laws could raise human rights issues by interfering with the right to privacy, a lawyer has warned.

item.title: Perth obstetrician Rhys Bellinge jailed over drunken high-speed crash that killed Elizabeth Pearce
item.description: A Perth obstetrician who killed a 24-year-old woman after smashing his high performance luxury car into the small hatchback she was a passenger in is sentenced to 10 years and six months in jail.

item.title: Banning transgender women from lesbian group could 'undermine their dignity', court hears
item.description: Transgender women will have their dignity "undermined" and could be made to feel "inferior" if a lesbian group is allowed to ban them from events, a court has heard.

item.title: Trans-Tasman Yacht Race from Sydney to Auckland postponed after withdrawal of most entries
item.description: The first running of the Trans-Tasman Yacht Race between Sydney and Auckland is called off days out from the start, after the withdrawal of the majority of entries.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Torres Strait Island men jailed over 110kg cocaine bust at top of Australian mainland
item.description: One of three men who used a dinghy to haul 110 kilograms of cocaine onto the Australian mainland has been jailed after telling a court he was helping a friend in exchange for a free boat trip.

item.title: Ash Barty to return to golf, as three-time tennis grand slam winner ready to play NZ Open pro-am
item.description: Ash Barty, Kelly Slater and Ricky Ponting are among the multi-talented sports stars in action in the pro-am component of the NZ Open.

item.title: Inquest into Aboriginal woman's death in custody hears of daughters' grief from losing 'loving mother'
item.description: Tammy Shipley died in a NSW prison cell in December 2022 after consuming excessive water, a complication of schizoaffective disorder known as polydipsia. Today her children told a coronial inquest that "if love could have saved her, she could have lived forever".

item.title: Sunshine Coast man Riccardo Valenza charged with 31 offences, including 11 counts of rape
item.description: Sunshine Coast man Riccardo Valenza, 31, has been remanded in custody after police charged him with 31 offences relating to 11 alleged victims.

item.title: Gynaecologist referred to police after Four Corners report
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: This video shows Rhys Bellinge's erratic behaviour and driving in the lead-up to the fatal accident.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: WIN Network acquires Nine Darwin, expanding broadcast operations into the NT
item.description: Regional news broadcaster WIN has announced it will acquire Nine Darwin, just over a year after the Nine Network suddenly axed its Darwin TV news bulletin.

item.title: Anthony Albanese evacuated from The Lodge following security incident
item.description: The incident at Mr Albanese's Canberra residence led to the prime minister being taken to another location for several hours.

item.title: Russell Brand pleads not guilty to further rape, sex assault charges
item.description: British actor and comedian Russell Brand pleads not guilty in a London court to two additional charges of rape and sexual assault nearly two decades ago.

item.title: Reawakening
item.description: The Bondi Beach terrorist attack signalled the resurgence of the Islamic State terrorist group in Australia. For the past two years, ABC Investigations has tracked the group's revival, identifying key figures, mapping the network and raising questions about the response of police, intelligence agencies and governments.

item.title: Former Philippine leader Rodrigo Duterte drew up 'death lists' and boasted about murders, ICC prosecutors say
item.description: Former Philippines president Rodrigo Duterte personally drew up "death lists" and boasted about murders committed during his "war on drugs", an International Criminal Court prosecutor alleges at a crimes against humanity hearing.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie's family offers $1.42m reward to bring home missing mother Nancy
item.description: US TV host Savannah Guthrie has posted a video to Instagram offering a $US1 million ($1.42 million) reward for information leading to the recovery of her missing mother Nancy Guthrie.

item.title: Travel quiz, February 25: Can you win our race around the world?
item.description: Which European city is home to the Rijksmuseum? And which dance style is Argentina best known for?

item.title: Salmon Tasmania fighting proposal by regulator to revoke its licence to use antibiotic florfenicol
item.description: Tasmania's salmon industry is arguing the case to keep using an antibiotic being used to combat bacterial infection in fish stocks, as a possible ban on the drug's usage looms because of it being found in "non-target" species.

item.title: Gay and bisexual Sydney teenagers lured and bashed on camera in IS-inspired attacks
item.description: An ABC investigation has obtained distressing videos and victims' accounts of IS sympathisers hunting and bashing gay and bisexual boys on camera in Sydney.

item.title: WARNING: DISTRESSING FOOTAGE Young men attack a teenager in Strathfield Park
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Endometriosis sufferers fear progress could be undone by one surgeon
item.description: Endometriosis sufferers have been left "sick" and reeling over the findings of a months-long ABC investigation into a Melbourne gynaecologist.

item.title: Russia casts net wide for mercenary recruits: fmr presidential adviser
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Four years of war in Ukraine leaves Russia a 'spent force' with diminished influence, analyst says
item.description: For the first time since its invasion of Ukraine, Russia has lost troops faster than it can replace them. It's one of many grim milestones of a bloody war that has now been going for four years.

item.title: Aiva Anagnostiadis looks to future after breaking leg during F1 Academy rookie year
item.description: Armed with a strengthened determination to succeed on the race track, Aiva Anagnostiadis is ready to put her injury woes in the rear-view mirror.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: The uneven roads that lead to the trophy, from the intriguing North Korea, to favourite Japan
item.description: The Women's Asian Cup in Australia provides a chance for the Matildas and visiting nations to create history, bring attention to their countries like never before, and seek respect and investment. But each have had varied paths to get here.

item.title: Antisemitism royal commission underway, but does it have time to deliver effective change?
item.description: The antisemitism royal commission is underway, but it faces some real tests in delivering justice to those impacted in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Sir Donald Bradman died a quarter century ago but will 'always be 99.94 not out'
item.description: Sir Donald Bradman was a towering figure in Australian cricket and culture, and some of the game's commentators have paused to reflect on his ongoing significance to the sport 25 years after his death.

item.title: SA Labor's stamp duty policy appears at odds with former treasurer Stephen Mullighan's views
item.description: SA Labor has announced a plan to abolish stamp duty for those aged over 60 and planning to downsize at the party's election campaign launch, in what seems to be a major policy shift from the position detailed by the state's former treasurer.

item.title: Armidale community rallies to welcome refugees from Democratic Republic of Congo
item.description: Churches and families rally around Congolese refugee arrivals in a NSW town known as a welcome zone for those fleeing crisis.

item.title: Irma Palasics's husband recounts her brutal murder in violent home invasion
item.description: A jury has watched hospital footage of Irma Palasics's husband describing the night she was killed in 1999, as two men stand trial over her death.

item.title: Australian Chamber Orchestra welcomes 416yo Italian viola into its collection
item.description: The instrument is believed to be one of the finest tenor violas in existence and the only surviving example of its kind.

item.title: UK government supports release of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's trade envoy documents
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was arrested last week on suspicion of misconduct in public office amid claims he shared confidential government information with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Trump Tower developer David Young ran business that collapsed owing $28 million
item.description: The businessman behind a proposed Trump Tower on the Gold Coast ran a development business that collapsed owing $28 million.

item.title: Hundreds of former prisoners potentially exposed to HIV and hepatitis C after a prisoner shared needles
item.description: A Queensland Health communique has revealed hundreds of former prisoners were potentially exposed to HIV and hepatitis C after an inmate shared injecting equipment in prison.

item.title: Scott Vincent Ward charged with allegedly grooming Philippines mother to sexually abuse her children
item.description: The man was searched by Australian Border Force officers when he arrived at Brisbane Airport after returning to Australia on a flight from the Philippines.

item.title: Albanese urges country to 'turn the heat down' after bomb threat — as it happened
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has called for the heat to be taken out of political debate following a bomb threat on The Lodge.

item.title: Pilot study into early diagnosis of pancreatic cancer by screening diabetes patients to launch in Brisbane
item.description: The study is the first step into investigating whether pancreatic cancer screening — via a non-invasive CT scan — could help save lives by early detection or warning signs.

item.title: Craig Tiley to leave Tennis Australia for role with United States Tennis Association
item.description: Tiley has been tournament director of the Australian Open since 2006 and Tennis Australia CEO since 2013. He'll remain in the role while Tennis Australia appoints his successor.

item.title: Louvre Museum director resigns in wake of brazen October crown jewel heist in Paris
item.description: Louvre Museum director Laurence des Cars resigns after months of pressure following the brazen theft of crown jewels, water damage, staff strikes, overcrowding complaints and a suspected ticket fraud scheme.

item.title: Thirteen million trees to be replanted after pine plantation wiped out in Walwa-Mt Lawson fire
item.description: The fire threat in Victoria's Upper Murray has eased, but the region's famously green, undulating hills still bear the black scars of a devastating bushfire.

item.title: Human remains confirmed as abducted Sydney grandfather Chris Baghsarian
item.description: Two men are arrested less than 24 hours after police discovered human remains near a golf club in Sydney's north-west.

item.title: ASX 200 hits new high, Australian dollar climbing — as it happened
item.description: The local share market is at record levels, while the Australian dollar is climbing after inflation was steady at 3.8 per cent in January. WiseTech and Woolworths shares surge.

item.title: US Winter Olympic ice hockey hero Jack Hughes excited to meet Donald Trump as mum defends Kash Patel video
item.description: US ice hockey star Jack Hughes defends his team after video of them laughing at Donald Trump's joke about the women's gold medallists sparks backlash.

item.title: Open letter asks PM to 'urgently rescind' appointment of NT administrator David Connolly
item.description: Politicians, advocates and civil society leaders have made a last-ditch plea for Anthony Albanese to intervene ahead of the swearing-in of controversial incoming NT administrator David Connolly.

item.title: Mount Isa experiences most February rain on record
item.description: Dry red dirt turns to flowing rivers and lakes as heavy rainfall breaks a century-old record in Mount Isa.

item.title: Connor Rogers recovering from 11 surgeries after nearly losing leg in tackle during local footy game
item.description: A catastrophic footy injury during a Melbourne reserves game changed Connor Rogers's life in an instant. In the aftermath, the support of his local footy club helped him recover and showed him the power of community. WARNING: This article contains graphic imagery.

item.title: Iran signs 'secret' $700m deal for Russian air defence systems, reports say
item.description: Iran has reportedly signed a secret arms deal with Russia to acquire thousands of advanced shoulder-fired missiles to help boost its air defences.

item.title: Thai officials say 72 tiger deaths at tourist parks not caused by bird flu
item.description: Thai authorities say tigers in confined environments can be particularly vulnerable to the canine distemper viral infection.

item.title: Indigenous landscape board chair resigns amid investigation into Telstra
item.description: The Alinytjara Wiluṟara Landscape Board chair steps down, saying his ability to speak for a region where Telstra is under investigation for alleged environmental breaches was impeded.

item.title: Perth doctor Rhys Bellinge's 'entitled, callous' behaviour killed Elizabeth Pearce and ruined lives, court told
item.description: Sought-after obstetrician Rhys Bellinge appeared to have it all — but that changed in an instant when his drunken, high-speed driving killed a young university graduate and left a rideshare driver with permanent injuries.

item.title: Wittenoom traditional owners launch $1.5b asbestos contamination claim against WA government
item.description: Banjima traditional owners say the thousands of hectares left poisoned by decades of asbestos mining have caused one of the highest death rates of mesothelioma in the world.

item.title: Lake Moondarra overspills for the first time since since 2011
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Yuin elder and public educator Aunty Ruth Simms publishes first children's book, Muttonfish Magic
item.description: Aunty Ruth Simms has published her first book, Muttonfish Magic, as she prepares to celebrate five decades in the public education system.

item.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine unbroken after four years, but Russia vows to fight on
item.description: World leaders gather in Kyiv to mark four years since the launch of Moscow's full scale invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: NSW government launches 24/7 rapid response unit in hate-related offences crackdown
item.description: More than 200 police officers equipped with long-arm rifles will be deployed to places of worship, major events and mass gatherings like protests on a risk basis.

item.title: Esperance farmers grapple with feral pig surge in WA's south-east
item.description: Farmers call for government support to curb the number of feral pigs in WA's south-east after a rapid jump in numbers.

item.title: How Han Xu's arrival at Perth Lynx has taken the WNBL by storm
item.description: The Perth Lynx were a middling side after eight games of the WNBL season, but the arrival of Han Xu sparked an astonishing turnaround in their fortunes — both on and off the court.

item.title: Farmer hopes to represent Australia snowboarding at the Paralympics four years after losing leg
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Farmer hopes to represent Australia snowboarding at the Paralympics four years after losing leg
item.description: Aaron McCarthy stepped onto a snowboard four years ago. This week he hopes to qualify for the Winter Paralympics.

item.title: Born in a Taxi and Osadía to bring roving performance magic to WOMADelaide
item.description: Melbourne's Born in a Taxi will join Spain's Osadía in bringing their unique performances to the world music festival next weekend, but they point out street theatre has not always been received well.

item.title: Lizzie McGuire and Revenge of the Nerds star Robert Carradine dies at 71
item.description: Robert Carradine — the youngest member of a legendary Hollywood family — dies, with his loved ones revealing his struggle with bipolar disorder.

item.title: Trump swipes at Supreme Court in longest State of the Union speech — as it happened
item.description: US President Donald Trump has addressed Congress in the annual State of the Union speech. Take a look back at how events unfolded.

item.title: Mexico's president insists 'no risk' as cartel clashes fuel worries in lead-up to FIFA World Cup
item.description: Claudia Sheinbaum says there is "no risk" to fans coming to the country to attend FIFA World Cup games despite the recent capture and death of Mexico's most-wanted cartel leader.

item.title: Truckie charged over crash which killed two train drivers has died, court told
item.description: A truck driver charged over a fatal crash which killed two freight train drivers at a level crossing on the Barrier Highway has died.

item.title: Security threat prompting PM evacuation linked to intimidation of Chinese dancers
item.description: The prime minister was forced to evacuate the Lodge last night due to a bomb threat linked to performances in Australia by a classical Chinese dance and music group that is banned in China.

item.title: Sydney doctor Jamal Rifi says IS-linked families in Syria should return
item.description: Australian doctor Jamal Rifi has been helping to coordinate a potential repatriation effort from Syria, including by obtaining passports for the families.

item.title: ACCC 'Down Down' arguments questioned by judge in bombshell court case against Coles
item.description: The judge overseeing a bombshell federal court case has made a stunning intervention as the consumer watchdog makes closing arguments.

item.title: Woolworths shares have best day on record as food sales and profit beat expectations
item.description: Woolworths shares rally 13 per cent on a well-received result. The supermarket's shareholders will receive an interim dividend of 45 cents per share, up from the same time a year ago.

item.title: Australian man Peter Williams given 7 years' jail for selling US trade secrets to Russian broker
item.description: A judge in Washington DC has sentenced Australian man Peter Williams to 87 months in prison for selling sensitive information to a Russian broker.

item.title: Cull and swimming ban resume after fatal shark attack in New Caledonia
item.description: New Caledonian authorities ban beach swimming and resume shark culling despite concern from environmental groups, after a wing foiler is killed in an attack.

item.title: Inflation in January slightly hotter than expected, keeping RBA rate hike on table
item.description: Headline inflation was 3.8 per cent in January, which was unchanged from December, but underlying inflation increased slightly. Both numbers were higher than expected.

item.title: Woman's family sues NT government over Tennant Creek watch house death
item.description: The family of a woman who died in police custody in Tennant Creek is suing the Northern Territory government for negligence, alleging officers failed in their duty of care after her arrest and that the 44-year-old was held in an "overheated" cell.

item.title: Teenager denies driving car that crashed on Canberra road killing 15yo passenger
item.description: A Canberra boy on trial for manslaughter denies being behind the wheel of a stolen car that crashed and killed another teenager outside Parliament House.

item.title: "Our country is winning again": Trump invites US men's hockey team to Congress
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Trump takes swipe at US Supreme Court over tariff ruling
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: NSW premier flags new laws after IS-inspired attacks on gay and bisexual teens
item.description: The New South Wales premier has flagged harsher punishments and new criminal offences in response to gay and bisexual teens being lured online and bashed on camera.

item.title: City of Adelaide review its camera car operations for issuing parking fines
item.description: An Adelaide council administration is reviewing its camera-mounted vehicle as a driver says she was mistakenly fined for performing a U-turn in a permit parking zone.

item.title: Police will not charge Canberra bar owner after seizing posters under new Commonwealth hate laws
item.description: A Canberra bar owner will not be charged with breaching Commonwealth hate laws for displaying posters depicting world leaders and a billionaire in Nazi-like uniforms.

item.title: Payne Haas rejects Michael Maguire rumour in NRL move from Broncos to Rabbitohs
item.description: Payne Haas speaks publicly for the first time about his move to South Sydney in 2027, explaining why he is leaving the Brisbane Broncos.

item.title: Video shows Ian Wally attempting to set police officers on fire in Perth.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: WA man who tried to set police officer on fire sentenced to four years in prison
item.description: Ian Wally attempted to use a jerry can full of petrol to set a Perth police officer on fire.

item.title: Southern Downs Regional Council rejects developer's proposal for water bottling facility on Cherrabah
item.description: Farmers say their fight continues after the local council knocked back a Chinese company's bid to extract almost 100 million litres of groundwater a year to bottle and sell.

item.title: What is duty sex and how do you stop having it?
item.description: Obligatory or duty sex is most common in long-term relationships, but can also happen in casual relationships where sex is the basis of the connection.

item.title: Connor Rogers learning to walk again after terrifying knee injury
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: WA's population on track to reach 4 million by 2043 amid housing shortfall
item.description: Four million people are tipped to live in Western Australia by 2043 according to a new report which warns the boom could be derailed by a housing shortage.

item.title: Troy Maskell found guilty of 73-year-old Strathmerton postmaster's manslaughter in retrial
item.description: A jury has found Troy Matthew Maskell guilty of a 73-year-old Strathmerton postmaster's manslaughter during a retrial ordered due to inadmissible evidence.

item.title: Alleged bomb threat against Gold Coast's HOTA theatre over Chinese dance group
item.description: Shen Yun has been the subject of several threats, including one against Australia's prime minister on Monday.

item.title: Angus Taylor says federal Liberals must 'do better' as he joins Ashton Hurn in Adelaide
item.description: Opposition leader Angus Taylor responds to SA Liberal leader Ashton Hurn's criticism of her federal counterparts, as he joins her on the state campaign trail in Adelaide.

item.title: High rainfall has been recorded in parts of far west NSW
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Outback SA and NSW record up to 200mm overnight, with another 100mm of rain forecast
item.description: Some pastoralists have already recorded 215mm of rain overnight, with the coming days forecast to bring an additional 100mm in some parts north-east of SA and far west NSW.

item.title: AFL says umpires' opinion still matters after announcing Brownlow Medal voting change
item.description: The AFL confirms umpires will be able to access player statistics before casting their votes in a bid to quell any controversy around the Brownlow Medal count.

item.title: Rhys Bellinge manslaughter sentence supported by Roger Cook, but Basil Zempilas disagrees
item.description: WA's political leaders are at odds over the sentence given to obstetrician Rhys Bellinge for a fatal drunken car accident, with Premier Roger Cook backing it and Opposition Leader Basil Zempilas saying it was "on the light side."

item.title: Suspects arrested in relation to kidnapping murder of Chris Baghsarian
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Victorian opposition to expand Melbourne's CBD, fast-track growth area homes under housing plan
item.description: Victorian opposition leader Jess Wilson vows to scrap plans for higher-density residential buildings in Melbourne's middle-ring suburbs — and focus on expanding the CBD instead — if her party is elected later this year.

item.title: Canberra man accused of sexually assaulting woman he held captive tells jury he was under attack
item.description: A man accused of holding a woman captive and sexually assaulting her until she fled naked into a Canberra street has told a jury he was the one under attack.

item.title: Australia at risk of 'supercharged' harm from unregulated AI, Toby Walsh warns
item.description: Renowned AI expert Toby Walsh has used a National Press Club address to warn the Australian government about what he argues are inadequate approaches to regulating the technology.

item.title: Police find car of alleged Mullewa shooter Kenneth John Giles
item.description: Police find a white Nissan Patrol belonging to alleged gunman Kenneth John Giles nearly two months after he allegedly shot his partner and sparked a major manhunt.

item.title: Public sector workers 'furious' as Tasmanian government denies reneging on pay deal
item.description: The Tasmanian government has labelled claims it reneged on a pay agreement as "incorrect" and says it is disappointed the unions are labelling recent talks in that way.

item.title: Donald Trump says he won't allow Iran to have a nuclear weapon during State of the Union address
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Standout moments from Donald Trump's State of the Union speech
item.description: The president gives the longest State of the Union speech in US history, delivering a 108-minute address to shatter Bill Clinton's 89-minute record.

item.title: Teenager first in SA to be prosecuted for allegedly creating deepfake images
item.description: A suppression order has been lifted on the identity of the first South Australian man to be prosecuted for allegedly creating and sharing sexually explicit deepfake images.

item.title: WiseTech Global to cut 2,000 jobs as AI ends era of 'manually writing code'
item.description: The company says almost one third of staff across 40 countries would be affected by the redundancies as a move towards AI sees a reshaping of its workforce.

item.title: Matildas goalkeeper Mackenzie Arnold unfazed by minimal preparation ahead of Asian Cup
item.description: Mackenzie Arnold says she has enough game time and form behind her to perform in Australia's Asian Cup tilt.
